channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Will Lebanon Deal Break Gaza Deadlock? Experts Doubt It
item.description: Hamas is unlikely to compromise in Gaza, despite the decision by its ally, Hezbollah, to stop fighting. A deal in Gaza would also be harder for Benjam...

item.title: What Is Russia’s Oreshnik Ballistic Missile?
item.description: The weapon used for the first time against Ukraine last week is capable of carrying nuclear weapons.

item.title: What Is Russia’s Oreshnik Ballistic Missile?
item.description: The weapon used for the first time against Ukraine last week is capable of carrying nuclear weapons.

item.title: Want to cut government waste? Start with the penny says U.S. Senator to Musk
item.description: Countries like Canada and Australia have stopped producing one-cent coins for more than a decade. Sweden was a first mover in 1972.

item.title: Maine Becomes the Latest State to Sue Oil Companies Over Climate Change
item.description: In a new lawsuit, the state’s attorney general claims oil companies deceived the public about fossil fuel products’ contributions to climate change.

item.title: Cease-Fire in Lebanon Takes Effect
item.description: The truce is intended to stop more than a year of fighting between Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah.

item.title: Two Presidents, Two Policies, One Superpower: America in Transition
item.description: Even as President Biden brokers a cease-fire in Lebanon, President-elect Donald J. Trump is running his own foreign policy without waiting to be sworn...

item.title: Even if you think education is a local issue, STEM is key to national security
item.description: Across the board, American K-12 students struggle to meet math and reading proficiency standards.

item.title: Two Presidents, Two Policies, One Superpower: America in Transition
item.description: Even as President Biden brokers a cease-fire in Lebanon, President-elect Donald J. Trump is running his own foreign policy without waiting to be sworn...

item.title: A Fragile Israel-Hezbollah Truce, and a Push to Make You Love Plastic
item.description: Plus, the A.I. granny scamming the scammers.

item.title: Record November Snowfall Hits Seoul
item.description: The first snowfall of the season grounded flights and triggered a weather warning throughout the South Korean capital.

item.title: Vauxhall workers face 140-mile relocation or losing their jobs as Stellantis plans to shutter 120-year-old factory
item.description: More than 1,000 Vauxhall workers will need to move from Luton to Cheshire to keep their jobs as Stellantis consolidates EV manufacturing.

item.title: The new ‘land grab’ for AI companies, from Meta to OpenAI, is military contracts
item.description: Silicon Valley generative AI companies are getting over their aversion to working with the U.S. Department of Defense, as the pressure builds to get r...

item.title: Sanofi CEO Paul Hudson takes inspiration from ‘Fight Club’ to get his team hooked on AI
item.description: Hudson says many CEOs are scared of AI, comparing it to The Terminator’s John Connor traveling back in time to stop the rise of the machines.
